examples: It's not surprising you feel weak if you haven't eaten properly for days.

definitions.definition: not strong in character, so that you are not able to make decisions or to persuade or lead other people:
examples: He was a weak king surrounded by corrupt advisers.

definitions.definition: A weak argument or excuse is one that is not likely to be accepted or believed:
examples: Any evidence that exists to support the hypothesis is fairly weak.

definitions.definition: A weak drink contains a lot of water compared to its other contents, so that it does not have a strong flavour:
A weak acid, alkali, or chemical base does not produce many ions (= atoms with an electrical charge) when it is dissolved in water.
